dt: {bc}a shot in billiards or pool made by hitting the cue ball vertically or nearly vertically on the side to drive it around one ball in order to strike another

et: French, from past participle of {it}masser{/it} to make a massé shot, from {it}masse{/it} sledgehammer, from Middle French {it}mace{/it} mace
shortdef: a shot in billiards or pool made by hitting the cue ball vertically or nearly vertically on the side to drive it around one ball in order to strike another

dt.t: moved the inmates {it}en masse{/it} to the new prison

shortdef: in a body : as a whole
